entry.title: Fix iOS/Picasa sync
entry.content:
When importing photos from an iOS device into Google Picasa, sometimes an error -9912 occurs, which cannot be fixed on the client side. This error is the result of a corrupted meta data file on the iOS device. The problem can easily be fixed, a single file needs to be deleted.

Remove the file on the iOS device by connecting to it with a file browser or SSH.

The file will automatically be recreated by iOS, when opening the Photos.app. Picasa should then synchronize perfectly.

Thanks to Hicken Design.
